Hey Mary,

Just watched "La Terra Spezza" and I have to say, it was a sobering reminder of the importance of taking care of our planet. You're right, it's always inspiring to see how art and creativity can intersect with environmentalism.

Speaking of intersecting interests, I've been practicing some new tunes on Fender Play, and I came up with an idea for a new project that I think you'll enjoy. I was thinking of incorporating sustainability into an old classic, "Climb Ev'ry Mountain" from The Sound of Music. I think it would be a fun way to continue incorporating sustainability into rock music, just like we've been doing with F1's eco-friendly initiatives.

In the meantime, let's plan to meet up soon and give bouldering at BoulderWorld a try. I can't wait to see how you incorporate "Climb the Green Mountain" into your climbing sessions, and maybe we can come up with some new eco-friendly climbing routes together!

Talk soon,
John

Hey Mary,

Just wanted to let you know that I tried out bouldering at BoulderWorld today and it was a blast! I can see why you enjoy it so much, it's a great way to combine creativity and physical activity. I'm looking forward to incorporating it into my F1-inspired tunes.

As for Fender Play, I've been enjoying "Rockin' in the Free World" by Neil Young. I can definitely see how the lyrics could be interpreted in an eco-friendly context, it's a great way to continue incorporating sustainability into rock music.

Talk soon,
John
